com.vaadin.addon.charts.model
Class Dial

java.lang.Object
  com.vaadin.addon.charts.model.AbstractConfigurationObject
      com.vaadin.addon.charts.model.Dial
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Dial
extends AbstractConfigurationObject

The Dial class contains options for the dial or arrow pointer of a gauge chart.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

Dial

public Dial()
Method Detail

getRadius

public String getRadius()
Returns:
The radius or length of the dial in percent.
See Also:
setRadius(String)

setRadius

public void setRadius(String radius)
Sets the radius or length of the dial. The value is specified in percentages relative to the radius of the gauge itself. Defaults to 80%.

Parameters:
radius -

getBaseWidth

public Number getBaseWidth()
Returns:
The pixel width of the base of the dial.
See Also:
setBaseWidth(Number)

setBaseWidth

public void setBaseWidth(Number baseWidth)
Sets the pixel width of the base of the gauge dial. The base is the part closest to the pivot, defined by baseLength. Defaults to 3.

Parameters:
baseWidth -

getBaseLength

public String getBaseLength()
Returns:
The base length of the dial.
See Also:
setBaseLength(String)

setBaseLength

public void setBaseLength(String baseLength)
The length of the dial's base part, relative to the total radius or length of the dial. Defaults to 70%.

Parameters:
baseLength -

getRearLength

public Object getRearLength()
Returns:
The rear length of the dial.
See Also:
#setRearLength(Object)

setRearLength

public void setRearLength(String rearLength)
The length of the dial's rear end, the part that extends out on the other side of the pivot. Relative to the dial's length. Defaults to 10%.

Parameters:
rearLength -
